chapter.title: &C2; Development
chapter.subtitle: Contributing to &C2;
chapter.para: This chapter contains information for &C2; developers.

section.title: Stable release procedure
section.para: Each &C2; release should be performed according to the following procedure:

formalpara.title: Update JavaDoc documentation
formalpara.para: Review JavaDoc documentation, provide missing public and protected members description, provide missing package descriptions.

formalpara.title: Update &C2; Manual
formalpara.para: Review &C2; Manual, modify or add content related to the features implemented in the new release.

formalpara.title: Update Maven dependencies
formalpara.para: Update Maven POMs so that dependencies are in sync with the JAR versions in the repository.

formalpara.title: Review of static code analysis reports
formalpara.para:
Review and fix reasonably-looking flaws from the following reports:
FindBugs
Code Duplication

formalpara.title: Update source code headers and line endings
formalpara.para:
In project root:
ant prerelease
Commit changes to trunk.

formalpara.title: Precondition: successful trunk builds
formalpara.para: The status of the C2HEAD-CORE and C2HEAD-SOURCES builds must be successful.

formalpara.title: Precondition: resolved issues
formalpara.para: All issues related to the software to be released scheduled (fix for) for the release must be resolved.

formalpara.title: Replace the stable branch in SVN
Update version number strings in the stable branch
Trigger stable branch build
formalpara.para: Go to the C2STABLE-ALL build page and trigger a build. If the build is successful, all distribution files should be available in the download directory.

formalpara.title: Verify the distribution files
formalpara.para: Download, unpack and run each distribution file to make sure there are no obvious release blockers.

formalpara.title: Update version number strings in trunk
formalpara.para:
In case of major releases, update development version numbers.
Version files
Update etc/version/carrot2.version to contain the desired development version number. Note the property name should be carrot2.version.head, e.g.:
carrot2.version.head=3.3.0-dev
# workbench plugin/ feature versions. carrot2.version.workbench=3.3.0.dev-snapshot
&C2; plugin versions in &DCW;
Update &C2; plugin version strings in the &DCW; to the current development version.
Commit changes to trunk.

formalpara.title: Update JIRA
formalpara.para: Close issues scheduled for the release being made, release the version in JIRA, create a next version in JIRA.

formalpara.title: Release notes
formalpara.para: Add a page named release-[version]-notes that lists new features, major bug fixes and improvements introduced in the new release. The page will automatically become linked from all relevant sections of the website (done by an SVN external to etc/version/carrot2.version).

formalpara.title: Release note history
formalpara.para: Add release date and link to the release's JIRA issues on the release-notes page.

formalpara.title: Upload distribution files to SourceForge
formalpara.para:
Perform (e.g. on the build server):
rsync -e ssh *-3.2.0.zip \ <sf.user>,carrot2@frs.sourceforge.net:/home/frs/project/c/ca/carrot2/carrot2/3.2.0

formalpara.title: Circulate release news
formalpara.para:
If appropriate, circulate release news to:
&C2; mailing lists
SourceForge

formalpara.title: Consider upgrading &C2; in dependent projects
formalpara.para: If reasonable, upgrade &C2; dependency in other known projects, such as Apache Solr and Nutch.

section.title: QA check list
section.para: This a very quick quality assurance check list to run through before stable releases. This list also serves as some guide line for further automation of acceptance tests.

note.para: Note that this list does not contain many checks for the &WA;, &DCS; and &JA; as these are fairly well tested during builds (webtests, smoke-tests).

listitem.para:
For each supported platform you can test, check that &DCW;:
launches without errors in the error log
executes and cluters a remote search query without errors
executes and clusters a Lucene query without errors (we've had a bug that caused the Lucene directory attribute editor to disappear, hence this step).
can edit a clustering algorithm's attribute
shows both cluster visualizations
executes clustering algorithm benchmarks
